Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2008 01:00PM janet516 wrote: Hello All, After finishing chemo and radiation in 2005 I complained of pains, fatigue, etc. and had my thyroid checked.  No problem there.  I developed rapid heartbeat last year and they checked thyroid again.  Still no problem.  I had heart and lungs checked, and then got a recumbent bicycle after finding out I was OK.  What a change in one month!  I pushed myself hard, to the point of collapse, and am getting stamina back finally.  My heart rate has gone down, and my fatigue is dissipating.  I wouldn't have believed it unless I experienced it, because I thought I was still in good shape, having worked and exercised throughout my treatment.  I was certain there was a medical problem.  Now, even if there IS a medical problem, I feel sooo much better.  If the docs can't find what's wrong, try biking in your bedroom.  There is no strain on anything but your heart, which might need a workout.
Posts.Title: Radiation Damaged My Thyroid Katiejane paige-allyson
